page.title: 19SERVICES IN STOCKTON.
page.content: A SURVEY WAS CONDUCTED TO ESTABLISH WHETHER THE VILLAGERS WERE SATISFIED WITH SERVICES.71% EXPRESSED THEIR GENERAL SATISFACTION,THE NETWORK & TIMETABLING OF THE BUSES ATTRACTED MOST CRITICISM;27% WERE SATISFIED WITH MEDICAL PROVISION.4O% SATISFIED WITH ACADEMIC STANDARDS & FACILITIES OF THE VILLAGE SCHOOL,11%WERE NOT.RECREATIONAL PROVISION RECIEVED MOST COMMENT,38% SATISFIED WITH ADULT SOCIAL ACTIVITIES,21%WERE NOT;ON THE YOUNGER SIDE 17% WERE SATISFIED WITH 25% DISSATISFIED. 62% CONSIDERED PUBLIC TRANSPORT INADEQUATE AND THIS WAS REFLECTED IN THE RELATIVELY HIGH LEVELS OF CAR OWNERSHIP,52 OUT OF 87 HOUSEHOLDS ENJOYING ACCESS TO AT LEAST 1 CAR AND 1O% ACCESS TO MORE THAN 1 CAR.
